website_summaries.verdict: Unique pop-out game play resonates with natural feline curiosity. Well worth a try for fussy cats who won't give other toys a second glance.
pros: 6 openings and a single unpredictable rotating feather keeps kitties guessing
Solid construction with anti-slip feet holds up well to pouncing and enthusiastic attacks
Comes with batteries and one replacement feather
cons: Nervous cats might be put off by the mechanical operating sound

customer_reviews.title: Scares my cats
customer_reviews.text: This thing is LOUD. I unboxed it, put the batteries in, and scared my cats. They have no idea what to do with it, I even tried to demonstrate. One of them tried to play with it and the whole thing stopped so he lost interest. I’ll update in a while to see if they’ll get used to it. Update: same day, several hours later. Even turned off, I tried to give them an opportunity to go near it, and they went as far away or around it as possible. They wouldn't even sniff it if I was holding it. I'll be returning this ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: A Hit with Our Cat!
customer_reviews.text: It certainly lives up to its name...our cat was anxiously watching the holes for the feather to pop out. He was actually able to grab it one time before it quickly retracted. Certainly held our cat's attention - it shut off once or twice thanks to the auto shut-off feature and we had to turn it on again, because he kept looking for the feather! Would recommend to other cat owners! Update a month later: Still a huge hit with the cat! From the minute it is turned on and he hears the sound, he is totally engrossed! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon K. Rajner

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love It!
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased a similar item previously that we had determined was too noisy for the cats' liking so I was hesitant to try this new product but it had good reviews so I took a chance and was so glad I did as the cats love it! Whenever I'm trying to get some work done at the desk and bored cats come looking for attention, I just turn it on and they flock to it. The nighttime feature is really cool, too, as you can really see the blue glow. The cats like the feather's movement and variety in coming out of several different spots on the toy. Definitely a favorite in our house of 5 cats.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.

customer_reviews.title: Fine product but cat doesn’t use
customer_reviews.text: Update to earlier review: The seller contacted me and offered a refund for this product. Given a cat toy is always a gamble I thought it was exceptional service and will consider their other products. First review: After reading reviews and my cat loving but tearing up a feather moving under a piece of cloth, I thought this would be a great durable alternative. But she hasn’t touched it once despite many attempts. I’m sure some cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad Not Good
customer_reviews.text: My one cat usually will play with anything. He, like other cats, loves when something pops in and out. For whatever reason he just doesn't know what to do with this thing. I think the major set back here is that the feather doesn't pop out all the way. The top of the feather gets stuck inside the mechanism and all you see is a folded feather. It is also kind of loud so, no go on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Black Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous - do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Almost immediately after turning it on, both our cats started to "look" into the holes on the sides to try to see what was popping out. Naturally when this this thing pops out it was going to stab them in the eye. We shut it off and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST INTERACTIVE CAT TOY I TESTED
customer_reviews.text: I have been researching interactive toys for cats. This is one of the worst. The motor is incredibly loud. The batteries only last one hour. (!) And our cats can't figure out what to do with it. The little thing pops out of the holes for a few seconds, then the annoying lights flash for a while, repeat. Worst of all, at some point cats have to "win" or it's just mean. There is no way for them to ever capture the popping out part. Returning. WHAT TO GET INSTEAD: Zenes Butterfly toy. Petlinks Electronic Motion Cat Toy.
customer_reviews.author: DisneyDenizen

customer_reviews.title: Too loud
customer_reviews.text: This toy is way too loud for cats. The feathers don't stick through the holes well, and it goes so fast, our cats don't even know what to think. It also lights up and flashes. Most cats are going to be put off by the sound, and the flashing light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Enthralled
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I wish it cane with is a remote. Elfie can't keep herself from it!. I have to keep pushing the button to turn it on. I'm also realizing I'm going to invest in AA batteries. Elfie is a ferrell cat I'm trying to befriend. She loves toys that make noise. She doesn't run and hide when I bend down to turn it back on. The automatic shut off is a good thing. It is sterdily made. Batteries come with it yet I can see them running down already. Had it going constantly for 2 hours. If you are going to spend money on a toy for your purrrrkid, this is a wise choice!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol L Frank

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the PetFusion Cat Toy Rotating Feather. It arrived in a timely manner. However, it fell apart the first day. I tried to fix it three times with tape, but it did not hold because the part that fell off was attached when the item was manufactured and there was no way to repair it. I called the company's customer support line twice and left messages. There was no reply, and I had to throw the product away.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine D. Kirchen

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Toy
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves this toy! He can’t wait until we take it out to play with. We’ve purchased so many cat toys that the cats aren’t interested in. Not the case with this Pet Fusion prospect. Cat fun all day long!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Brunelle

customer_reviews.title: A habit forming toy
customer_reviews.text: The 7-year old 'senior' expects me to turn it on every morning to greet the day. It took a couple of days for him to analyze it: he found that when he caught the feathers he couldn't carry the unit off (too heavy). It may be flipped over during his tussles but still working. NOW I recommend that the company provide a remote control to turn it on again (and again).
customer_reviews.author: COpurchaser

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Likes it more than cat!
customer_reviews.text: Mechanical Noise Trick! If your cat, like mine and many others, is intimated by the mechanical sounds associated with this very clever toy, here’s a trick I learned. My cat is a pretty outgoing cat but was intimated by the noise. I sprinkled a patch of catnip on the floor, let my cat get all hammered, slid the toy up near him while his nip indulgence and voila! No longer does he fear the toy, it’s new favorite actually. The only pet that enjoys it more than the cat is our new puppy, a sheltie who cannot tolerate movement without her permission!
customer_reviews.author: The ADHD Perspective

customer_reviews.title: Was great at first, but 2 weeks after return period closed it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved this! It is loud and only lasted a few minutes before I had to turn it on again, but they went crazy over it when it was on. Unfortunately, the motor has stopped working already. I put in brand new batteries and it just makes a weird noise and stops when I turn it on. My cats just sit there pawing at it all disappointed. Do not waste your money on this! I can’t even return it because my return period ended 2 weeks ago. :(
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT ENTERTAINMENT FOR CATS
customer_reviews.text: My cats looooove this toy. They instruct me to turn it on all the time by putting a paw on it. They get hypnotized by it. A little loud, but you have to find a balance overall.
customer_reviews.author: mk cat

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT.  Your cats will love it
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a similar product in the past but THIS is the BEST. Our cats love it! The blue light gives it a little extra attraction for them. The feather part screws into place which is a great feature. One of our cats have figured out how to "catch" the feather and will run, dragging this entire toy across the floor. Because the feather screws in, she can't dislodge it from the devise. It's made sturdy and puuurrrfect for our active cats.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Hall

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: The feather falls apart very easily it’s too flimsy. I had to take the bits of feather out of my cats mouth so he wouldn’t choke on them. It also goes too fast so he lost interest within 3 minutes. There should be a slower setting not just the purple “change feather” setting
customer_reviews.author: Maria V.

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Were Terrified Of This Toy
customer_reviews.text: Good interactive cat toy idea, but was incredibly noisy. Both cats were absolutely terrified of this toy due to the noise it makes. I thought that if I left running a bit, that they would come around. Well, they would not even come into the room with and steered clear. After I shut it off, they still walked way away from it and were scared to even get close to it in off mode.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about two weeks now and I would say it's not worth it. Not sure if I got a bad product, but it stops working after its first cycle. You have to take out the batteries or wait like 10 minutes before using again. It's also really loud. It comes with lights that I'm not sure if you can turn off, but they're blinding bright.
customer_reviews.author: Tejeda

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy, my only complaint is that it should stay on a little longer. We get up and turn the thing on 50 times a day, a remote would be even better so when she wakes me up in the middle of night because she wants to play I could just click the remote, hahaha (sorry, it's all night long) we have just started having to hide it in the closet at night to keep her quiet.
customer_reviews.author: KDalpez

customer_reviews.title: Good if your cat likes to attack noisy things that move.
customer_reviews.text: One cat loves it, one doesn't mind it and enjoys watching it and the other avoids it completely. Toy is pretty good at entertaining them but I think it should move a little slower every so often instead of as fast as it does all the time and the bright light on top is kind of annoying. This is definitely a noisy toy, but I knew that from the reviews and the cat I purchased it for fears nothing, so I was ok with it. Turns out that cat is the one that just watches it, instead of the one playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Kinda small...
customer_reviews.text: A little smaller than anticipated. Should’ve known it would be a bit noisy so my cat was somewhat leery of it and showed no interest. Hoping new kitten I’m adopting soon might like it. Update: Kitten couldn’t care any less about this toy. The feathers barely poke out of the holes so I’m not even sure what any cat is supposed to do with this toy. Don’t waste your $ on this one.
customer_reviews.author: CindiKRyan

customer_reviews.title: Noisy! And broke in less then 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Update after about 19 days of very little usage and when it was used the cats mostly just looked at it. ****broke. the light works, the feather stopped comin gout unless you stuck a pencil in it to jump start it. Yes I changed the batteries ****25 days the light works, the feather completely stopped even with assistance. Yes I changed the batteries again. Top lights up, feathered thing randomly pops out the side wholes. But...its noisy, really noisy. The cats will just look at it. I admit they are not kittens, but they will play with other less noisy toys. Overall to much money for a noisy toy the cats loom at.
customer_reviews.author: Us Moore

customer_reviews.title: Minimal Value
customer_reviews.text: My cats destroyed the unit within 1 hour play. They quickly became bored with the feather activity and just ignored it. Their first response was to time the feather popping out, bite down on it the drag the toy away. All feathers ripped out of the unit within minutes. OK, so I have Bengals and they seem to be too intelligent to cope with this rudimentary toy. It may be just fine for average cats.
customer_reviews.author: Lorax

customer_reviews.title: Yes.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy! We bought it for one of our kitties that is getting rather pudgy but our other cat monopolizes it. He usually just bats at it but sometimes will catch the feather part in his mouth and drag the whole toy across the room. The feather stays attached and nothing breaks which I am pleased by. One thing that is disappointing is that it stays on for maybe four minutes before turning off, not eight. Hardly a big deal, especially because as others have mentioned it is rather loud so I don’t want to listen to it for a long time anyway. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah R.

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite toy.
customer_reviews.text: This is my cat's favorite toy. I have bought 2 of them and gave one to a friend that has 2 cats. I have even opened one up and put a wifi board into it and hooked it up to a 5 volt power supply with the plug in the battery compartment. Now I can turn it on with Google Assistant and turn it on with my phone from anywhere and watch on a camera when he plays. I even bought the extra feathers. Very neat toy. Thank you for making it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toy for our 1 year old cat. She loves it. It randomly pops a feather out of one of 6 holes and keeps the cat guessing which one it will be. Highly recommended. It's also cool because it has an on-off blue light that glows. Comes with a second feather but the cat has managed to capture the feather on occasion and it has held up so far.. Sounds like a Dot-Matrix printer for those of you who know what that is. For the price - it's greatly recommended. For the FUN it's a must have for kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: My cats favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My cat is obsessed with this toy. I got it for her for Christmas & almost couldn’t wait to open it for her beforehand. She’s incredibly hyper & wants to play 24/7. She plays with it everyday & she begs meto turn it on again when it goes off. I believe it has a 8 or 10 minute interval. She was a little standoffish at first because it seemed a little loud, but after a week, it became her favorite toy. I don’t know how the feather has managed to last as long as it has with the way she plays with it, but they included a replacement feather for when we need to change it out.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time, my mom's cat will just sit/lie there and watch it. Every once in a while, he goes into attack mode. When we first started it, the feather only came out a little bit. After he hit it a couple of times, it appears that the feather comes out further now. It just came out a little bit and stayed there. It keeps the cat's attention, whether he's just watching it or "hunting it". I didn't think that he was too enthused with it, until it stopped (auto-stop after 15 minutes). Then he looked at me and started meowing. After I turned it back on, he went back to watching it.
customer_reviews.author: CP7212

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made
customer_reviews.text: I thought the toy was attractive, and well built. My cat, however, will have nothing to do with it. It isn't the toy's fault. My cat, like many, has a mind of his own, and is not influenced by what I like. Your cat may play with it, and be stimulated by it for ever. As cat owners , its up to us to try and provide stimulation for our pets. It is always up to them to train us to their ways.
customer_reviews.author: Donald C Powers

customer_reviews.title: Cats love, kinda loud
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy! Feather is super durable! Arlo can be a pretty aggressive player, normally breaks most of his toys quickly, but this toy has held up after many episodes of playing!! It does come with a replacement feather in case its needed. This toy is pretty loud. Not very heavy so cats move it around when playing with it. Only way to recharge this toy is by replacing the batteries. Toy didn’t come with the battery plate screw. Battery plate does click into place so it is pretty secure without it though. Overall, I’m glad I got this toy for my boys and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: My Cat's Favorite: Just as Tough as He Is
customer_reviews.text: Of the electronic toys I have purchased for him, this is my cat's favorite. Like any toy, he has lost interest over time, but less in this one than in other toys. I don't think it said so on the Amazon page, but this does eventually turn itself off. My very young and very rough cat has grabbed the wand repeatedly, dragged the entire toy four feet across the carpet, jumped on it and generally been very rough with it. It is still functioning fine. I am still on my first wand. It is loud, but my cat doesn't care about that; yours might.
customer_reviews.author: SkippyJo

customer_reviews.title: Loud but OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my 8 month old kitten needs to be "entertained" most of the time. She really likes the interactive toys. While this product is sturdy and will probably last awhile, it is REALLY loud and goes in and out so fast that the cat does not have time to realize most of the time that the feather came out. I would not recommend it for the money it cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: Hate it!
customer_reviews.text: Both cats HATE IT! It’s WAY too loud, the feathers come and go superfast, even my young, playful cat can’t keep up with the speed. This toy is awful!! Straight in the trash...
customer_reviews.author: ViperDriver

customer_reviews.title: Probably best for active cats, not lazy ones :-)
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this after reading many positive reviews. Right out of the box, my cat had zero interest in it. Then one day when he was being particularly crazy, I turned it on, and it was a hit! So, for us, it works best when he is already wound up. If I turned it on right now (while he is sleeping) he would not come out to engage with it. It's enjoyable for me to watch him - it's really funny! Some reviewers mentioned that this toy is noisy, and it is a little. My kitty is not afraid of the vacuum cleaner, and this is definitely quieter than that!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Loud, Moderate Engagement
customer_reviews.text: This makes a lot of noise, which is annoying when trying to listen to anything else whilst cat is playing with this toy. Worth it if my cat has some fun? Absolutely. Interesting design. Will post an update after some time.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Nice "action" toy for your cat
customer_reviews.text: My main "complaint" about this is it makes a fairly loud whirring noise, which made my twitchy cat even more nervous. She ignored it the first 3 times I turned it on, giving it a wide berth as she walked by. But she couldn't stand it anymore and had to check it out on the 4th try. At first, she waited by the first hole the feather came out, being too stupid to realize it came out of different holes each time. Once she figured that out, she actually started to play with it. I found it highly amusing to watch her, so I guess you can call this a people toy too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PetFusion Ambush Interactive Cat Toy
customer_reviews.text: Have 3 indoor cats they love the toy, took a couple days to get comfortable with it, now they won't leave it alone, when it stops they just stare at it like what happen to it, one of them even try's to push the button in the center of it to start again LoL, wish she could so I didn't have to. All cats are different our outside Tom cat comes in see's it, he could care less. But then again he play's with everything outside. Our indoor cat's don't have that option. It's worth a try if you love your cat's.
customer_reviews.author: mickey

customer_reviews.title: ****Revised Review  Yawn!
customer_reviews.text: ****With the addition of our new puppy we have been trying to find ways to keep him happy as he is a fireball of energy and we are worn out! This interactive cat toy has saved the day! Pup absolutely LOVES it and keeps him busy for as long as it keeps running! At least that's what my cats say about their new toy. I had high hopes that this would keep them a bit more interested/active but no luck. Love the multi-function features but again, no response from my furry children.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: (1) Although this toy performs as shown, the motor is noisy and spooks the cat. Amazon deceptively hides this fact in their video of this toy by playing loud bouncy music that drowns out the motor noise. (2) the feather pops out for such a short time I doubt that the toy would hold any cat's attention for long.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I really loved the idea of this toy for my cats, but they aren't very interested in it. The motor is fairly loud and that seems to be the biggest thing that my 2 cats dislike. While I would not purchase this product again, it may be suitable for young kittens/cats who are extremely excitable. Five stars because customer service was EXCELLENT! When I reached out to them regarding the cats not liking the toy they promptly offered me suggestions to help acclimate them and a replacement of a different toy.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: My 2 cats went crazy over this
customer_reviews.text: Now this is what I call one of the greatest gifts from Santa Paws, Gave it to our cats (both grown) this morning and they have been playing steadily with it ever since. While there is a slight sound when on it is so minor that it doesn't both the cats at all. I love the automatic turn off feature however I wish there was a way to chose it staying on longer as I have now turned it on over 8 times today. The quality, design and cost are fantastic. I highly recommend it to all cat parents.
customer_reviews.author: Dari

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 3 cats like this
customer_reviews.text: My cats are 1yo, 10yo, and 12yo. The 1 and 12yo like this. Currently the 1yo is wearing an e-collar and she can play with this, which is good since most other toys are a problem. I haven't tried replacing the feathers yet. One improvement: motion detection. I have one toy with motion detection so after I turn it on and it times out, it'll go on again when one of the cats walks by or tries to play with it. I really like that when I have to be at work it gives them something to play with.
customer_reviews.author: K. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Miss Molly says NO but Sammy says YES
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool toy but my cat just sits and stares at it. Miss Molly is usually fearless, but the loud noise is off-putting for her. I put it away for a while and tried again later, but she still doesn't like it- and won't touch the feather things, despite me showing her how to grab them. A dud in our house. Revised: Gave this to my friend's cat Sammy who loves it! She says that several times a day he asks her to press the button to make it go! So I averaged my one star with friend's five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Cat E. Clysm

customer_reviews.title: Just arrived in the mail.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in the mail. It came with the batteries, a nice surprise. I was expecting to have to buy AAs again. Showed it to my feather nutty fur baby, so far she likes it. It's a little bit loud, the usual mechanical sounds. And it does move a little fast in the first speed. But she likes it and you can change the speed. It seems to have two settings. Second much slower, easier for kittens. Has kept her busy for ten minutes now. That's saying something for an elderly cat.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Kylean

customer_reviews.title: Well, they're not NOT interested
customer_reviews.text: So, *I* think this thing is really well-made, and it's totally great. The cats... well, they aren't kittens anymore (they're 7) so it's not like they're all over it, but whenever I turn it on in the living room, they both come trotting out from wherever they had been lounging and WATCH it, sometimes they're swat/ bite/ bat at it, but they might also sit there and STARE at it. Whatever makes them happy is fine by me, and I think it does. It came with a second feather attachment, and the batteries. I didn't expect it to make quite so much noise, but it's not a dealbreaker. Just know that you definitely hear the mechanics inside while it's running.
customer_reviews.author: Person Who buys things

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This keeps my cat's attention and is sturdy enough to take his abuse. Plus it's heavy enough to stay in place, unlike lighter ones. He was a little confused at first since he only looked from one side and missed opposite side until I played it with him. Now he watches from the top and "kills" it!
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy and company
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old russian blue kitten adores this toy. If he is being naughty we turn it on and he comes running. He was able to pull the button off the top trying to turn it on himself. Otherwise very good. Also the best customer service I've received from any company. Very highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my adult cat!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 year old cat that doesn't like toys anymore. He much prefers a live prey to chase and play with. Trying to find something indoors and safer has been near impossible....until I saw this toy. I bought it thinking it will probably go to the corner with rest of them as he just sat there and stared at it for a day or two when it was on and did nothing. Then he sat near it and I saw him pawing at the feathers as they come out. He has had it a few weeks now and finally he has a toy that he really enjoys!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda K

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good play for multiple cats
customer_reviews.text: Our four cats are fascinated by this toy. They got it for Christmas and still come to it whenever I turn it on, for as long as it’s on. They can eventually catch the feathers, but as soon as they let go it starts up again. They’ve dragged it around by the feathers a lot, in their mouth, but it hasn’t broken, nor have any of the feathers broken off. It’s on an auto timer so I can turn it on and leave them to it without worrying about using up the batteries, which I’ve only had to change once. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this toy for 6 months now My kitty absolutely loves it. No matter where it is, he's always running up to attack the feathers. Or as seen in the pics, he likes to try to catch it with his mouth (I think he believes he has a better chance that way) He has pulled on it several times, caught it with his mouth and doesn't let go, and the toy still works great. I haven't changed the feather yet, though they do give you an extra one in case. It beeps which I could do without, but I still love the toy and I know my cat does too so it's a win for us! :)
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: Having a single cat means that they expect you to PLAY with them. That can get exhausting so I bought this toy. Many of the other toys I have bought last a few days before they were torn up or broken or just left alone. This one keeps her occupied, alert and happy for about 5 min. then it shuts itself off. I LOVE that feature so I don't have to monitor the toy. Even when my cat catches one of the feathers it pulls back so fast that she can't tear it off. It sometime just exhausts her. If you do not use too frequently then they won't get bored with it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Loud loud loud
customer_reviews.text: This thing is loud. I'm disappointed that this wasn't mentioned more in these reviews. The mechanism can be heard from all rooms in the house. This is a deal breaker unless you are using it to entertain your cat when you are away for 8 minutes. The feather does not poke out far, which isn't necessarily a con if you are worried about your cat actually grabbing it, but my cat lost interest in chasing it and just watched it. It does come with a replacement feather and has suction cups to help hold the machine in place. It comes with batteries!!! It shuts off after 8 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: phelps, krystal phelps

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE this so I love this :-)
customer_reviews.text: The video is Clyde on day 3. He was a little apprehensive, but even more curious. Initially, I turned it on every time I walked past it until both of my cats got used to the noise which took a few days and now it’s no problem. A positive aspect of the noise is that it creates a great distraction if the cats start fighting or misbehaving - they hear the toy and come running to play. It gets turned on at least 20 times a day. PetFusion is a brand I know and trust so I thought I’d try this toy and it did not disappoint. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: my cat loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: At first my cat wasn't sure, he just watched for the first few times I turned it on. Then he got a little involved and swatted at the feather when it came out the hole in front of him. After the first few days, he started sitting by the toy and crying for me to turn it on. It seems very durable. It comes with an extra feather for when he manages to shred the one that's attached. It's a little noisy, but I don't find it irritating. It turns itself off after several minutes which I like because It saves batteries and keeps the cat from getting bored. I think this is a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Clever little cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Nice. But cat got bored with. Cats. Go figure. Older cat. Kittens will love it. Recommend keep it out of sight and pull it out only during playtime. Only modification I’d recommend to manufacturers is to decrease the amount of time the feathers are exposed. Cats are more inclined to obsess about things they can’t quite catch. Either that or make the speed variable so users can speed up or slow down based on cat’s quickness...
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A Warren

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had remembered to return this toy before 30 days was up. The toy good idea, but way too noisy. It frightens my cat and annoys me. I thought if I let it run often enough she would get use to it. She has accepted the noise but gives it a wide berth and certainly doesn't play with it. Oh well, fickle cat. The toy does run fine, for the most part. Sometimes it gets jammed up.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Durable, fun, cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Some have said that their cats are afraid of the noise. And it is noisy. I have 5 kitties. Mine surround it like it's a zebra on the Serengeti and try to kill it. Two carry it away once they "catch" it. My cats are HARD on toys. So far so good. One cat is deaf so the combination of lights and movement keep him interested for a while. I've been VERY happy with this toy. But more importantly, so have the kitties!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Super loud toy
customer_reviews.text: Well, my cat likes to watch this, which prevents him from chasing our older cat. So that is a win. Verdict still out on if he will actually interact with it. Which is basically any cat toy you buy for any cat, amirright?!? Huge complaint though, this toy is incredibly loud. It just sounds like a toy that could break at any moment but is trying it's best. It seems to work fine but is obnoxiously loud.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: My finicky cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I have a picky cat. I have tried so many electronic toys. She does not care for them. However, to mu surprise she took to this one! I love how it lights up. It is sturdy and I like the fact you can buy replacement feathers and it is easy to install them. I wish it ran for 30 minutes, but I know that would drain the batteries fast. It’s a good toy and I would recommend. It is not quiet though, you will hear it chirping, clicking, making different sounds with the movement, but kitty loves that too!
customer_reviews.author: Christie Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a playful cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves this thing. I enjoy playing with him with strings and stuffed toys when I get home from work, but when that gets boring, he'll walk over to his PetFusion Ambush and start chirping for me to activate it. Sometimes, he gets so excited to play with it, that he attempts to turn it on himself by pawing at the rubber button in the center. Come to think of it, that probably would have been a great option, but I still recommend this product to anyone who has a playful cat.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Good product but cats lost interest
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a very good product, but initially, we had to put it on the mode of replacing the feather because at its main speed, it was way too fast for the kitties. They enjoyed it for about 2 weeks and then lost interest. This seems to be a pattern with them, so I'm not blaming the product. It does everything they said it would and I think any cat who enjoys chasing things would find it fascinating.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kritchel

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this 5 stars but my cat just wasn't interested. Returned and got their cat scratch lounger which my cat just loves. She spent the first few days after I got it scratching away and just lounging on it. All cats are different and mine is more a lounger and scratch-er than a chaser. Maybe cause she's getting older. If your cat is very interactive I'd recommend giving this a try.
customer_reviews.author: Ardy 7 Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this and so do I
customer_reviews.text: My spoiled cat has all kinds of toys and rarely plays with them for very long. This one is different. She loves it and sometimes just lies beside it and waits for it to come to her, then she pounces. It's sturdy, looks like a little space ship, and has no tacky rough edges. Beautiful design and nice features like turns itself off after a while so you aren't always replacing batteries and comes with extra feathers, just in case. Nicely weighted so your cat isn't pushing it all over. It mostly stays where you put it, imagine such a concept.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Whitfield

customer_reviews.title: Interactive toy slightly loud
customer_reviews.text: My cat took a day to warm up to it because it does have a pretty loud noise to it but after that he loved it! It is a little fast for him but I think he enjoys watching it and then when it gets slow he attacks and when it’s off he wants more! My other cat just likes to watch still but she is very picky about what she plays with. Good product for the price super amazing toy for when you don’t have enough time to play with your cat enough each day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only for brave cats
customer_reviews.text: During the first run, my two-year-old rescue male cat just watched. A few days later, he started to interact. Now he indicates when he wants me to turn it on. My neighbor's two female cats (one very young, one very old) were not interested, even a bit afraid.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Vandervort

customer_reviews.title: Cats loved it
customer_reviews.text: My cats both played with this toy for months and months. Before they lost interest in it .....I’m going to put it away for a little while....and then bring it back out..... I wish it played a little longer before it shuts itself off..... But both of my cats loved it ... It was pretty durable ...my cat would catch it and drag it around the floor.... It’s still held up great!!!
customer_reviews.author: kittens

customer_reviews.title: Cat's Meow
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! My "guy" loves it! The only thing that would make it perfect would be if he could turn it on himself!!!! Goes off after 8 minutes which is great because I am notorious for forgetting to turn things off - I'm replacing batteries every other day. And the fact that I received a follow up telling me that the product could be returned if you have a skittish cat that might be afraid of the motor noises! Amazing!!!! Really great product, really great company!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loves this toy. It’s got great interactivity and it’s pattens are randomized. I has an 8 minute times so it shuts off automatically. It’s Piper approved
customer_reviews.author: Ian C

customer_reviews.title: Attention grabber for all age cats
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!!! Both my 14.5 year old cat and my 6 month old grandcat love it! My only wish to the manufacturer is to put a wake up time on it so it turns on 15 min before feeding time Or when I find my kitten typically needs play time like 3 am!
customer_reviews.author: JILO

customer_reviews.title: My Cat's Favorite Toy
customer_reviews.text: First, it came WITH the batteries!! My Kitty could watch this all day and night. Fortunately the toy stops after awhile. Seriously though, even when its not on she lays on the floor with one eyeball at one of the holes. My only suggestion for improving the toy would be a remote control, she's so obsessed I'm constantly getting up to turn it on again. But I'm not complaining, its good to see her happy, after all she's the queen and I'm her servant. ha ha
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Tuell

customer_reviews.title: entertaining
customer_reviews.text: At first our 1 year old ragdoll just watched the toy but after several days she began to interact with it trying to catch the feathers. We found she likes it best when we place it on the ottman so she can sneak up on it. She now meows so we'll turn it on for her! We also love the fact that it entertains her when she's looking for attention and we're busy or heading out. It's great that it automatically turns off. Happy we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Once your kitty analyzes how the toy works be ready to buy more batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I am fostering a shelter dog and car it took a few days for the cat to be enticed to Olay with it he didn’t know how to play! Once he analyzed the action of the toy he adores it ! When the feathers pop out he rushes to grab them and then pulls the unit to his blanket then the other side pops out and he drags it to the other side of the room! He even figured how to turn it back on! Your product is awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: tatiana Lipnitskaia

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: My cats enjoy it! Every now and then one of them will grab the feather in their teeth and drag it around the room! It does make some noise but not nearly what I was expecting given other reviews. I’m sure after a while they’ll get bored with it. They’re like toddlers, I’ll put it away for a while and when I take it out it will be all new to them again.
customer_reviews.author: The Nonna

customer_reviews.title: Cats come running when this starts up!
customer_reviews.text: I already have 3 Pet Fusion scratching loungers for my cats, so I knew of their product quality. But this has exceeded my expectations. When I push the button on the top my cats come running to play. They can hear me start it from anywhere in the house, and here they come. It is entertaining and gives them some surprises as the feather pokes out the various holes. Product feels substantial, not flimsy, and batteries seem to last fairly well. My only wish is if it would turn itself on,( that is from my 3 cats!).
customer_reviews.author: Rphilli

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: My cat is picky on toys. When I got this out of the box and running, criminy I never seen her so intrigued before on any of the massive toys we have bought her. She was on this for so many hours. and the next day, after it again. It shuts down after 10 min, I had to push the button to restart it, she meowed if I did not. Cat loves this. after a week, she knows it and wants something new, thats a cat, but then I started it again, and she went for it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Very fun toy!
customer_reviews.text: The noise the unit makes is a little intimidating for my two young cats (8 weeks old), but my adult 3 yr. old cat finds it fascinating! He watches and watches it to see if he can figure out where the feathers are coming out next! I think the kittens will join in on the fun as they become a little older as they sit close and watch my other cat!
customer_reviews.author: Horse Lady

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Rated durability and sturdiness of this cat toy a 5. Why? BECAUSE IF THE CAT WON'T PLAY WITH IT of course it will hold up. This is a total waste of money. Cat played with it, at most, a total of 2 days then the novelty wore off quickly. It's pretty noisy also. Took toy to friend's house who just got 2 kittens. Ditto for them; 2 days and done. Not worth the money or even the time to order the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is noisy
customer_reviews.text: That being said. It handles it just fine, when my cat bites the feather thing & tries to carry the machine off. I think, aside from the noise, this product could only be made better if it had a motion detected "on" feature. That way the cat could entertain herself when ever she wanted. I haven't quite got her to figure out how to press the "on" button herself.
customer_reviews.author: Mandie

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for active cats
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cats to encourage more play and they had no interest, so I gave it to my parents to see if their 2 yr old cat would play. He ADORES it, to the point where he drags the thing around the house by the feather. It's a bit loud from the motor, so if your cat spooks easily, I'd shy away from this. Batteries last a long time (unless your cat plays with it every waking moment).
customer_reviews.author: miri

customer_reviews.title: Like a Cross Between Simon & Whack A Mole for Cats!
customer_reviews.text: Runs well and makes mechanical noise, but not too noisy. The randomization is great - keeps the cat from outsmarting the toy or getting bored. Cat gets upset when the eight minutes of play runs out and toy automatically shuts off. Came with extra feathers but haven't had to replace them yet. Fam is so glad we got this for the cat!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Matanski

customer_reviews.title: Puts kitties in the "zen" mode
customer_reviews.text: I turn on the toy. Kitties gather around. Pupils dilate. They lay down in pounce mode and zen out! It's pretty hilarious to watch. Occasionally one will attack the feather, but for the most part they seem to go into an ultra-heightened relaxation mode. This toy turns itself off after 8 or so mins, at which point one of the kitties will alert me that it's time to push the button again. Great toy. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine T. Crist

customer_reviews.title: My cats favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: This is my cats favorite toy, well designed and durable(he is very rough on his toys). The motor noise is not loud and is comparable to other electronic toys I have for him, it depends on the cat, my parents cat was scared of the noise. So far I have had this toy 1 month and it has help us well from daily use. If you have a high energy cat, I highly recommend this toy!
customer_reviews.author: claudia moore

customer_reviews.title: PetFushion Interactive Cat Toy
customer_reviews.text: I received this toy as a gift for my new kitten. He loves it! And...so do my older cats! They like it so well that I bought a second one as I have 7 cats. It is well constructed. It even shuts off after a certain amount of time, so you don’t have it running after your cat loses interest in it. That also saves the battery. I would recommend this to anyone who has a cat or cats of any age. They will love it!
customer_reviews.author: K. Zander

customer_reviews.title: Fun but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Our cat really enjoys this toy! It seems durable but it is still new. Our cat bites the feathers and pulls the toy around the room but it has held up so far! My only complaint is the noise. Our other cat is terrified of it because it’s too loud so be sure to take that into consideration. If you have a timid or anxious cat this is likely not the toy for them. If you’re cat doesn’t care about noise then I highly recommend this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hall

customer_reviews.title: petfusion cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Takes too long for feather to pop out. My cat is 13 years old and not skittish. She plays with her wiffle ball and rubber mouse. When I activate petfusion, she sits and stares at it. Her expression, to me at least, says, You've got to be kidding. I no longer have the box it came in. I will appreciate how I can return it for a refund
customer_reviews.author: A,E. Giaquinto

customer_reviews.title: My boys love this toy
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. My cats love this toy. One of my cats is actually able to turn these toys on by himself but unfortunately not this one. He tries but cannot push the button in far enough. If I was to mention cons of this cat toy, this would be it. Otherwise this was a good buy. The boys love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Two Kittens Are Entranced
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for a few days, so my durability answer is a guess-it looks durable. It's too heavy for the cats to move, & the feathers pop in and out very quickly, so I doubt they'll be able to chew them off. They are fascinated by it & it's really attractive, which is not something I'd say about any other cat toy I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: just another toy that doesn't entertain
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats. 3 of them are not interested in this toy at all. The other just sits and watches the feather pop in and out of the holes. It makes a good door stop though.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this
customer_reviews.text: My cats [3], love this toy. They play with it as long as I will let them. I have to put it away so they will leave it alone. Two of them have watched me turn it on enough that they dig at the button to turn it back on. They go to the closet it is stored in and dig and cry at the door for me to get it out. It goes without saying that I would purchase again and recommend it highly in all regards.
customer_reviews.author: Orchard Mom and Dad

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit
customer_reviews.text: While it's not the most pleasant thing to listen to, and on that note, the company offers returns if the sound scares your kitty. It feels like it could stand up to serious abuse without being heavy enough to worry about pinched paws. The only real reason I can't give it a full five stars is that the replacement feathers aren't exactly cheap when it takes your cat a day or two to remove half of the feathers. All in all though it's one of the few "autonomous" cat toys that our cats will actually play with that we can actually walk away from.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Talbott

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 cats
customer_reviews.text: This interactive toy is great my girls absolutely love it!! Keeps them busy! I had this for less than a year and it stopped working I was so upset because my girls love this. After looking at date of purchase I realized it has only been six months so I contacted seller who then sent me a replacement hassle free! I would highly recommend this! I now have a 11week old kitten with a lot of energy and this will keep him busy for awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: annoying
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted my cats to enjoy this toy but they did not play with it. I think they found it a little "too much". I found the noise and lights annoying so neither my cats nor I liked the toy. I think it is well made and I hoped it would be a good toy for them. I am going to give it to my friend for her cat.
customer_reviews.author: apcalc

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away - LOUD/ Feather Gets Stuck
customer_reviews.text: As much as I love my cat, I wish I would have never purchased this. Sadly, the return window has ended and it’s been used twice. The machine is extremely loud and the feather gets stuck often. It is so loud and has such annoying mechanical issues, that my cat doesn’t even enjoy it. Save yourself some money and buy a regular cat toy kit.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana B

customer_reviews.title: Durable automatic cat toy!
customer_reviews.text: Very entertaining for cat. It’s her favorite self play toy since I got it. I like the auto shut off function, as I can turn it in before I leave. Replacement feather option makes it a keeper, but that being said my cats played with it quite a bit and the feathers still look brand new, so it’s very durable!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Our pets love it
customer_reviews.text: The cat is really laid back, but he does love playing with this toy. The surprise is our chihuahua. He gets SO excited when we get this down from the shelf. He will play with it non-stop until we turn it off. So far, it has been durable. The dog catches the feather often enough that it makes me nervous but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: GaryG

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great design for a cat toy. It's compact and sturdy. Bigger toys with moving parts sometimes overwhelm my cat. This is the perfect size and I love how he can drag it around when he catches the poof. It just keeps working and functioning perfectly. It maintains his interest, but when he's done playing, it shuts itself off. I could not be happier with this toy!
customer_reviews.author: hedgehog

customer_reviews.title: Loud and bright, but it's a hit!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. It's a little loud but she doesn't care. It just kinda makes it annoying for me since I got it to distract her when we're watching tv in the living room. It's very sturdy and she managed to grab the feather and carry the whole thing a couple of steps away. The light is very strong and I'm concerned it might hurt her eyes specially at night. Other than that, is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Valkyrie

customer_reviews.title: The cats love this toy, I wish it had a remote
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful cat toy and my cats love it the only problem is it only lasts about five minutes and then they’re crying for me to turn it on again. It really needs a remote or a timer because they want to play with it all day and I can’t keep stopping from work to push the button but I recommend it for your cat mind love
customer_reviews.author: dale ann clancy-fagan

customer_reviews.title: Takes some time for csts to get used to it
customer_reviews.text: Just got this product, unbox it put on the floor, turned it on, and none of my cats like it. It is loud and obnoxious, my cats are not thrilled with this at all and neither am I. Update... Took a few days of having it turned on for them to start to show interest in it. Now they look forward to playing with it. Changing my star count.
customer_reviews.author: Bashiba

product_meta.title: PetFusion Ambush Interactive Electronic Cat Toy with Rotating Feather. (Smart Modes, Nighttime Light, Auto Shut-Off, Batteries Included). Replacement Feathers Available. 12 Month Warranty
product_meta.description: Size:Full unit| Color:PearlAMBUSH INTERACTIVE is an automatic cat play device based on the idea of simulating a hunting experience using moving objects. The feather will randomly pop out from 6 holes at different time intervals. With added color LED lighting, cats are drawn into the experience to catch the feather. Great for daytime or nighttime hunting. Interactive toy for both kittens and older cats
feature_bullets: CAPTIVATE YOUR CAT'S ATTENTION & SATISFY ITS HUNTING INSTINCTS: (i) Unique stimulating cat or kitten toy that simulates prey popping out from 6 entries with a randomized and fast paced feel. (ii) LED lighting great for daytime or nighttime!
HELPS KEEP YOUR CAT NIMBLE, PHYSICALLY FIT, & MENTALLY STIMULATED: (i) Focused, interactive play can improve your cat's overall wellness & happiness.
ANTI-SKID FEET: (i) keeps the toy in place on smooth surfaces like hardwood floors and tile.
FEATHER EASY TO REPLACE: (i) A second mode extends and pauses making it easy to replace. (ii) 3-pack replacement feathers available for purchase.
BATTERIES INCLUDED: (i) Long battery life with 8 minute auto-shut-off feature. (ii) 12 MONTH WARRANTY on any part that is broken due to manufacturer defect.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
